Package com.intellij.ide.impl

Class PatchProjectUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.ide.impl.PatchProjectUtil

  • public class PatchProjectUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility to patch project model by excluding folders/files from content roots. Can be used for running offline inspections (from command-line directly or in teamcity). The main logic is in the method patchProject(com.intellij.openapi.project.Project).
    See Also:
    InspectionApplication

    • Method Detail

      • patchProject

        public static void patchProject(Project project)
        Excludes folders specified in patterns in the idea.exclude.patterns system property from the project.

        Pattern syntax:

        • patterns := pattern(';'pattern)*
        • pattern := ('['moduleRegEx']')? directoryAntPattern
        Where
        • moduleRegex - regular expression to match module name.
        • directoryAntPattern - ant-style pattern to match folder in a module. directoryAntPattern considers paths relative to a content root of a module.

        Example:
        -Didea.exclude.patterns=testData/**;.reports/**;[sql]/test/*.sql;[graph]/**;[graph-openapi]/**
        In this example the testData/** pattern is applied to all modules and the pattern /test/*.sql to applied to the module sql only.

        Parameters:
        project - project to patch
        See Also:
        http://ant.apache.org/manual/dirtasks.html

      • patchProject

        public static void patchProject(Project project,
                                java.util.Map<java.util.regex.Pattern,java.util.Set<java.util.regex.Pattern>> excludePatterns,

      • loadPatterns

        public static java.util.Map<java.util.regex.Pattern,java.util.Set<java.util.regex.Pattern>> loadPatterns(java.lang.String propertyKey)
        Parses patterns for exclude items.
        Parameters:
        propertyKey - system property key for pattern
        Returns:
        A map in the form ModulePattern -> DirectoryPattern*. ModulePattern may be null (meaning that a directory pattern is applied to all modules).
